meanings.definition: The bright red substance formed by the combination of hemoglobin with oxygen in the lungs.
meanings.sent1: When we breathe, our lungs create oxyhemoglobin, which helps carry oxygen in our body.
meanings.sent2: Doctors can measure the levels of oxyhemoglobin in your blood to check how well your body is oxygenated.
meanings.sent3: The oxyhemoglobin in our blood is like a superhero, swooping in to save the day by delivering oxygen to our cells.
meanings.sent4: The oxyhemoglobin danced with joy as it embraced the life-giving oxygen, turning bright red in the process.
meanings.sent5: The image of oxyhemoglobin carrying oxygen is as vivid as a red balloon floating through the bloodstream.

meanings.definition: The form of hemoglobin that carries oxygen in the blood.
meanings.sent1: Oxyhemoglobin is crucial for transporting oxygen from the lungs to all parts of the body.
meanings.sent2: Athletes have higher levels of oxyhemoglobin, allowing them to perform better during intense physical activities.
meanings.sent3: The oxyhemoglobin in our blood works tirelessly, like a dedicated courier ensuring oxygen delivery without delays.
meanings.sent4: In the bloodstream, oxyhemoglobin acts as a loyal carrier, never dropping its precious cargo of oxygen.
meanings.sent5: The role of oxyhemoglobin as an oxygen carrier is as essential as a key unlocking the energy in our cells.
